context: The Estonian word 'tahe' refers to the human capacity to choose goals and strive toward them, meaning will, willingness, desire, or volition. It encompasses both mental determination (like 'strong will') emotional desires (like 'wanting something'), and conscious choice. The word appears in various compounds such as elutahet (will to live), võitlustahet (will to fight), and töötahet (willingness to work).
